data.title: Art Center
data.text: AcA is a wonderful venue for live music. The visual art exhibits are fantastic and exciting. If you are luck enough to catch it open on Art Walk you will not be disappointed with the vibrancy of the downtown life at the AcA.

data.title: Incredible acoustics. Perfect size, not to large, not to small.
data.text: The director, Herr Prof. Dr. Gerd Wuestemann has very eclectic tastes in music. He is partly responsible for the incredible variety of performers that are brought to the stage. Because of the limited seating, the tickets are sometimes a bit pricey for some of the more incredible performers.

data.title: Excellent Venue for Live Music and More
data.text: This place is a wonderful addition to downtown Lafayette and a contribution to a lively artistic community. We have been to a couple of music shows at The Acadiana Center for the Arts and really enjoyed the acoustics while being close enough to the stage in any seat to really see the show. We recommend this venue to anyone...local or visitor.

data.title: The perfect venue for entertainment !
data.text: We attend performances at ACA several times a year. There is not a bad seat in the house, the acoustics are wonderful, a very intimate setting.

data.title: Ambience of arts meets Zydeco is superb as is the Pandora's box of opportunities to treat
data.text: After savouring  Pop's po boy, there is only one option, and that is to walk it off.... and so we did along the quaint, tree-lined streets of downtown lafayette. The glass-fronted Arcadia for the Arts champions works by local artists and schedules regular theatre, jazz and dance performances. The mood is intimate and artistically delicious, a zydeco band performing added that special touch. later we visited the San Souci Fine Arts gallery for incredibly personalised offerings of glassware, jewellery and exquisite knitted puppets. managed to get all the prezzies to take back to Oz in one hit. Double the pleasure.

data.title: Downtown Must Experience
data.text: At the heart of downtown Lafayette, a great place to experience an array of musical performances.  Beautiful art exhibits, quaint coffee shop with seating area to chat before a show or during intermission.  A lovely place!

data.title: Great Venue
data.text: Very nice venue for local or visiting art exhibits as well as small plays, music or comedic acts or other entertainment venues.  Very well designed and maintained.  Small auditorium gives everyone a stage front seat for entertainment shows.  I've been to plays, comedy acts, band performances as well as speaking events in the auditorium and have never had a bad seat.

data.title: Wonderful place for events for adults and families!
data.text: I have attended many events at Acadiana Center for the Arts.  The place has a very intimate feel to it and sound is wonderful.  I love particularly their Crossroads events where they take, say, a Cajun or Zyedco band and pair it for a concert with a Tex-Mex or Jazz group.  I have also taken my grandchildren to several family events and they have enjoyed them, as well.  Great place!

data.title: So many events, and very modern place
data.text: This is the main cultural centre in Lafayette. I have seen here great concerts like the one of Chick Corea, and many more great events. Also on one Sunday every month, about, they project live an Opera from the New York Opera Theater. And there are many artistic events through the entire year. Really a great place. And they even a decent Espresso and the bar near the entrance!

data.title: Great place to see some local artwork & a little cafe inside too!
data.text: If you are in the Lafayette area on the second Saturday of the month, ArtWalk is going on downtown, and the ACA is a great place to see some neat artwork and really experience the art diversity in downtown Lafayette. There's also a little cafe right when you walk in for anyone going any other time of day.

data.title: An Amazing Experience
data.text: With the freedom to walk around, at your own pace, gazing at wonderful art work, this is a must see.

data.title: Enjoy a little time for yourself!
data.text: We have been to several concerts at ACA and have enjoyed the gallery and the music. If you haven't been, please go and support the arts locally. If you haven't heard the UL Jazz Ensamble you have missed a treat. Hard working young folks and really excellent performances here at ACA...and other locations, so go see 'em

data.title: Art Walk Visit
data.text: Went for the 2nd Saturday art walk and enjoyed free admission! Stayed open until 9pm. Great last stop and crescendo at the end of our art tour. Cozy, modern atmosphere and a local gem of talent and artistic flare.

data.title: Great addition to downtown
data.text: Always a fun, cultural, and inviting place to visit. Has a variety of art work, & entertainment. I love the warm inviting feeling of theater space.

data.title: an intimate place to view the arts
data.text: small place for great groups , very intimate in that you are in close with the perfomers..good downtown location

data.title: Experience it
data.text: Like other reviews, liked the renovations. Now its finally modern and cozy. The exhibits were above average and wished we got there earlier to see it all. Would go back again to see other performances.

data.title: A fun night out
data.text: Beautiful building. A great place to see a performance - very up close and personal.  Always interesting exhibits.  Very supportive of the children of Acadiana, love Gulf Brew.  Wish that their exhibits turned over more frequently

data.title: A tasteful venue
data.text: The night we were there was a gala for Steve Riley and the Mamou Boys. It is a wonderful theater, smallish but sensibly designed. The performance was remarkable and the center made every aspect of the concert more delightful.

data.title: This was a shock!
data.text: We went to the newly renovated theater to hear music performed by members of the UL School of Music, and then returned for a performance by students of CYT. We had no idea how fabulous this venue is since the renovations were done. Congratulations to the Acadiana Center for the Arts for bringing Lafayette a first class venue for live performances, as well as art showings.

data.title: New theater is excellent
data.text: I love the art in the ACA and have come here when they have a new exhibit for the past 6 years. A year ago or so they finished and opened a theater for drama and plays, and it is very nice and professional. There is an in-house theater troupe that is outstanding!  My only complaint is that parking is hard there, as with all of downtown but it's no worse than anywhere else off from Johnston, and it's easy to go have a nice dinner before or after a show without moving your car.
